results.title: Energy everlasting
results.brief_description: Everyone knows that oil won’t last forever. The search for new forms of renewable energy is increasing. This film looks at some of the ways that are being used to explore the options available. In Indonesia and the Phillipines photo voltaics provide electricity for homes. In Sweden, biomass and hydroelectricity play an increasing role, and in other parts of the world, wind and wave power are playing their part. The costs of these systems are as yet untested in a harsh fiscal world but, in the next thirty years, some of these fledgling technologies will come more and more to the fore.

results.creator_credit: Larry Trust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Endotracheal anaesthesia
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, ICI (GB) and Realist Films
results.brief_description: Without a clear airway the administration of a general anaesthetic is impossible. This film shows how endotracheal anaesthesia overcomes this difficulty by intubation of the larynx. The advantages of endotrachael anaesthesia are summarised.

results.title: Endocrine glands
results.brief_description: By means of animation and microphotography, this film demonstrates the nature and function of the parathyroid, the pituitary, and the thyroid glands, and the pancreas. The use of insulin in treating diabetes is demonstrated, hyper and hypothyroidism are discussed, and stimulation of the mammary gland illustrated.

results.title: Endo what?
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Megan McMurchy, Bower Bird Films and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Endometriosis is a condition that affects about 15% of women between the onset of puberty and menopause. “Endo” occurs when the lining of the uterus, the endometrium, migrates to locations outside the uterus. This misplaced endometrium is most commonly found on the ovaries, uterus, bowels, bladder, ligaments, and on the Pouch of Douglas. This tissue bleeds every month and causes cysts and adhesions to form, sometimes binding organs together. Endometriosis often remains undiagnosed by doctors - the average length of time before a correct diagnosis is made is eight years. This short film features interviews with women of all ages and backgrounds who relate their experiences with “endo”. This video dispels the myths about endometriosis and offers positive suggestions for coping effectively with this condition.

results.title: Encore! : the best of Joan Sutherland
results.brief_description: Dame Joan Sutherland, Australian icon and declared National Treasure, has been described as the foremost soprano of our age and one of the greatest artists of all time. Live from the Sydney Opera House, performed by the Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra and conducted by Richard Bongyne, this video contains highlights of her stage performances with Opera Australia, including many of her most internationally famous and highly acclaimed roles.

results.title: Enchanted isles
results.creator_credit: Anglo-Scottish Pictures and Films of Scotland Committee
results.brief_description: A tour of the Hebrides, starting from Oban and crossing the water to Iona, St Columba’s Isle, and to Staffa and Fingal’s cave. The birthplace of Flora MacDonald and memories of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Also shows the industry and agriculture of the islands, including the weaving of Harris tweed.

results.title: Empty Land-New Life
results.brief_description: In 1956 the Ministry for Housing implemented the “Elderly Persons Housing Project” in an attempt to meet the growing demands for public housing by senior citizens. Over the years building costs have increased rapidly and the Ministry feels that if the Community were to donate land for the project this will enable them to continue building suitable accommodation at affordable prices.
